column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////It was our first time here and our first true Chicago Deep Dish Pizza. Let's just say that Lou's did not disappoint.  We ordered the small classic pizza and a bowl of minestrone soup. Wow.  Great flavors. It's kind of a joke but expect a nice buttery crust with a hint of cornmeal
column2: the restaurant's own proprietary recipe Italian sausage
column3: industrial-strength cheese all topped with a bright and chunky tomato sauce that tastes like tomatoes off a vine. Mmmm.   The souped was rich and tasty.  My recommendations are whatever size pizza you think you need
column4: buy the smaller one!  (It is really filling.). The second is take an UBER as the parking sucks.
